leaf_cluster.leaf_cluster_name: 物理-粒子/多体/动力学生态

queries: [WEB] gpu accelerated physics simulation frameworks github

tools.name: KHARMA
tools.one_line_profile: GPU-enabled general relativistic magnetohydrodynamics (GRMHD) simulation code
tools.detailed_description: KHARMA (Kokkos-based High-Accuracy Relativistic Magnetohydrodynamics with AMR) is a GRMHD code designed for simulating accretion flows onto black holes. It leverages the Kokkos performance portability library to run efficiently on various architectures including GPUs, and uses the Parthenon framework for adaptive mesh refinement (AMR).

tools.name: Castro
tools.one_line_profile: Compressible astrophysics simulation code for massive parallel architectures
tools.detailed_description: Castro is an adaptive mesh refinement (AMR) radiation-hydrodynamics code for astrophysical simulations. It supports compressible hydrodynamics, radiation transport, and self-gravity, designed to scale on massively parallel CPU and GPU systems using the AMReX framework.

tools.name: Emu
tools.one_line_profile: Neutrino quantum kinetics simulation code using Particle-in-Cell methods
tools.detailed_description: Emu simulates neutrino quantum kinetics in astrophysical environments using a Particle-in-Cell (PIC) approach. It is built on the AMReX framework and optimized for parallel execution on CPU and GPU supercomputers.

tools.name: MAESTROeX
tools.one_line_profile: Low Mach number stellar hydrodynamics simulation code
tools.detailed_description: MAESTROeX is a C++ code for simulating low Mach number stratified astrophysical flows, such as those in stellar evolution. It uses the AMReX framework for adaptive mesh refinement and parallel scalability.

tools.name: AMReX-Astro Microphysics
tools.one_line_profile: Collection of microphysics routines for astrophysical simulations
tools.detailed_description: This repository contains common astrophysical microphysics modules (nuclear networks, equations of state, opacity) designed to interface with AMReX-based simulation codes like Castro and MAESTROeX.

tools.name: Nyx
tools.one_line_profile: Adaptive mesh N-body hydro cosmological simulation code
tools.detailed_description: Nyx is a massively parallel code for cosmological simulations, solving equations for dark matter (N-body) and baryonic gas (hydrodynamics) on an adaptive mesh. It is built on AMReX and supports GPU acceleration.

tools.name: Amrvis
tools.one_line_profile: Visualization package for AMReX-based simulation data
tools.detailed_description: Amrvis is a specialized visualization tool designed to read, display, and analyze output data (plotfiles) and profiling data from scientific codes built on the AMReX framework.

tools.name: AMReX
tools.one_line_profile: Software framework for block-structured adaptive mesh refinement
tools.detailed_description: AMReX is a high-performance software framework for building massively parallel, block-structured adaptive mesh refinement (AMR) applications. It supports CPU and GPU architectures and provides core functionality for solving PDEs in complex domains.

tools.name: pyamrex
tools.one_line_profile: GPU-enabled Python bindings for the AMReX framework
tools.detailed_description: pyamrex provides zero-copy Python bindings for AMReX, allowing users to write AMReX-based applications or interface with AI/ML libraries using Python while maintaining high performance on GPUs.

tools.name: PeleAnalysis
tools.one_line_profile: Analysis and processing tools for reacting flow simulations
tools.detailed_description: PeleAnalysis is a suite of post-processing and analysis tools designed for use with the Pele family of combustion codes (PeleC, PeleLMeX), facilitating the interpretation of reacting flow simulation data.

tools.name: PeleC
tools.one_line_profile: Compressible reacting flow simulation code with AMR
tools.detailed_description: PeleC is an adaptive mesh refinement (AMR) code for solving compressible reacting flows. It is part of the Pele suite and is designed for high-performance simulations of combustion processes on modern supercomputers.

tools.name: PeleLMeX
tools.one_line_profile: Low Mach number reacting flow simulation code
tools.detailed_description: PeleLMeX is an adaptive mesh hydrodynamics code for simulating low Mach number reacting flows. It is the successor to PeleLM and supports complex combustion simulations without level sub-cycling.

tools.name: PeleMP
tools.one_line_profile: Multiphysics models for the Pele combustion suite
tools.detailed_description: PeleMP provides multiphysics modeling capabilities (such as spray and soot models) for the Pele suite of combustion codes, extending their applicability to complex physical phenomena.

tools.name: PelePhysics
tools.one_line_profile: Physics databases and routines for combustion simulations
tools.detailed_description: PelePhysics is a repository of physics databases (thermodynamics, transport, kinetics) and implementation code shared across the Pele suite of combustion codes.

tools.name: FHDeX
tools.one_line_profile: Stochastic hybrid models and algorithms for fluctuating hydrodynamics
tools.detailed_description: FHDeX provides AMReX-enabled code libraries for simulating fluctuating hydrodynamics using stochastic hybrid models and algorithms, suitable for mesoscale fluid simulations.

tools.name: LBMeX
tools.one_line_profile: Lattice Boltzmann methods implementation on AMReX
tools.detailed_description: LBMeX implements Lattice Boltzmann methods (LBM) using the AMReX software framework, enabling scalable fluid dynamics simulations on parallel architectures.

tools.name: AMReX-Hydro
tools.one_line_profile: Hydrodynamics routines for AMReX-based codes
tools.detailed_description: AMReX-Hydro provides a collection of hydrodynamics routines and solvers built on the AMReX framework, serving as a building block for various fluid dynamics applications.

tools.name: IAMR
tools.one_line_profile: Variable-density incompressible Navier-Stokes solver with AMR
tools.detailed_description: IAMR is a parallel, adaptive mesh refinement code that solves the variable-density incompressible Navier-Stokes equations, suitable for a wide range of fluid flow problems.

tools.name: incflo
tools.one_line_profile: Incompressible Navier-Stokes solver for complex geometries
tools.detailed_description: incflo is an AMReX-based solver for the incompressible Navier-Stokes equations, specifically designed to handle complex geometries and embedded boundaries.

tools.name: FerroX
tools.one_line_profile: Phase-field simulation framework for ferroelectric materials
tools.detailed_description: FerroX is a massively parallel, 3D phase-field simulation framework built on AMReX. It models ferroelectric materials for scalable logic devices, solving the time-dependent Ginzburg-Landau equation coupled with Poisson's equation.

tools.name: ARTEMIS
tools.one_line_profile: Adaptive mesh time-domain electrodynamics solver for microelectronics
tools.detailed_description: ARTEMIS couples Maxwell's equations (from WarpX) with classical equations for quantum materials (like LLG for micromagnetics and London for superconductors) to quantify next-generation microelectronics performance.

tools.name: taichi.js
tools.one_line_profile: Modern GPU compute and physics rendering in JavaScript
tools.detailed_description: taichi.js is a JavaScript library that enables developers to write high-performance GPU compute and rendering kernels (based on the Taichi programming language concepts) directly in the browser, suitable for web-based physics simulations and visualizations.

tools.name: rscope
tools.one_line_profile: RL training visualizer for Mujoco Playground environments
tools.detailed_description: rscope is a visualization tool for Reinforcement Learning training processes, specifically designed for Mujoco Playground environments and Brax. It aids in analyzing the behavior and performance of physics-based control policies.

tools.name: AlphaPPImd
tools.one_line_profile: Generative neural networks for protein-protein complex conformations
tools.detailed_description: AlphaPPImd utilizes transformer-based generative neural networks to explore and predict the conformational ensembles of protein-protein complexes, aiding in the study of molecular dynamics and interactions.

tools.name: ImpactX
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance beam dynamics modeling code
tools.detailed_description: ImpactX is a code for modeling beam dynamics in particle accelerators, accounting for collective effects. It is built on the AMReX framework and is GPU-accelerated, designed for exascale simulations.

tools.name: WarpX
tools.one_line_profile: Advanced electromagnetic Particle-In-Cell code
tools.detailed_description: WarpX is an advanced, massively parallel electromagnetic Particle-In-Cell (PIC) code. It is designed for simulating plasma physics problems, including laser-plasma acceleration and plasma mirrors, on CPU and GPU clusters.

tools.name: DDC
tools.one_line_profile: Discrete Domain Computation library for HPC
tools.detailed_description: DDC (Discrete Domain Computation) is a C++ library designed to simplify the development of high-performance scientific codes by providing abstractions for discretized domains and fields, supporting parallelism and GPU acceleration.

tools.name: TCLB
tools.one_line_profile: Templated MPI+CUDA/CPU Lattice Boltzmann code
tools.detailed_description: TCLB is a high-performance Lattice Boltzmann Method (LBM) code that uses C++ templates for efficient code generation on both CPUs and GPUs (via CUDA). It supports MPI for large-scale parallel fluid simulations.

tools.name: PyQUDA
tools.one_line_profile: Python interface for the QUDA library for Lattice QCD
tools.detailed_description: PyQUDA provides a Pythonic interface to QUDA, a library for performing Lattice Quantum Chromodynamics (QCD) calculations on GPUs. It facilitates QCD research by combining Python's ease of use with QUDA's performance.

tools.name: particular
tools.one_line_profile: GPU-accelerated N-body simulation library in Rust
tools.detailed_description: particular is a Rust library for N-body simulations. It implements algorithms like Barnes-Hut and supports GPU acceleration (via wgpu), providing a flexible backend for physics simulations in Rust.

tools.name: PIConGPU
tools.one_line_profile: Performance-portable Particle-in-Cell code for exascale simulations
tools.detailed_description: PIConGPU is a fully relativistic, many-core Particle-in-Cell (PIC) code designed for simulating laser-plasma interactions. It is known for its performance portability across various hardware architectures (GPUs, CPUs) using the Alpaka library.

tools.name: larnd-sim
tools.one_line_profile: Simulation framework for DUNE pixelated Liquid Argon TPC
tools.detailed_description: larnd-sim is a simulation framework specifically designed for the pixelated Liquid Argon Time Projection Chambers (LArTPC) used in the DUNE experiment. It simulates the detector response and physics of neutrino interactions.

tools.name: EKAT
tools.one_line_profile: HPC C++ utilities and libraries for the E3SM ecosystem using Kokkos
tools.detailed_description: Tools and libraries for writing Kokkos-enabled HPC C++ in the Energy Exascale Earth System Model (E3SM) ecosystem, providing support for performance portability.

tools.name: SCREAM
tools.one_line_profile: Exascale global atmosphere model written in C++
tools.detailed_description: A fork of E3SM used to develop the Simple Cloud-Resolving E3SM Atmosphere Model (SCREAM), designed for exascale computing architectures.

tools.name: PICSAR
tools.one_line_profile: Modular physics routines for Particle-In-Cell (PIC) codes
tools.detailed_description: A library of modular physics routines for PIC codes, designed to help scientists port Particle-In-Cell codes to high-performance architectures.

tools.name: Cabana
tools.one_line_profile: Performance-portable library for particle-based simulations
tools.detailed_description: A performance-portable library for particle-based simulations, developed as part of the Exascale Computing Project (ECP) Co-design Center for Particle Applications (CoPA).

tools.name: CabanaMD
tools.one_line_profile: Molecular dynamics proxy application based on Cabana
tools.detailed_description: A proxy application for molecular dynamics simulations built on top of the Cabana performance-portable particle library.

tools.name: CabanaPIC
tools.one_line_profile: Structured PIC proxy app based on Cabana
tools.detailed_description: A structured Particle-In-Cell (PIC) proxy application built using the Cabana library for performance portability.

tools.name: Cajita
tools.one_line_profile: MPI+Kokkos library for logically rectilinear grids
tools.detailed_description: A library for managing logically rectilinear grids using MPI and Kokkos, supporting grid-based scientific simulations.

tools.name: ExaMPM
tools.one_line_profile: Material point method proxy application based on Cabana
tools.detailed_description: A proxy application for the Material Point Method (MPM) built on the Cabana library, used for continuum mechanics simulations.

tools.name: ExaMiniMD
tools.one_line_profile: Molecular dynamics proxy application based on Kokkos
tools.detailed_description: A proxy application for molecular dynamics simulations implemented using Kokkos for performance portability across different architectures.

tools.name: evox
tools.one_line_profile: Distributed GPU-Accelerated Framework for Evolutionary Computation
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive library and distributed GPU-accelerated framework for evolutionary computation algorithms and benchmark problems.

tools.name: metade
tools.one_line_profile: GPU-accelerated evolutionary framework for Differential Evolution
tools.detailed_description: A GPU-accelerated evolutionary framework that optimizes Differential Evolution (DE) strategies via meta-level evolution, supporting JAX and PyTorch.

tools.name: tensorneat
tools.one_line_profile: GPU-accelerated NeuroEvolution of Augmenting Topologies (NEAT)
tools.detailed_description: A GPU-accelerated implementation of the NeuroEvolution of Augmenting Topologies (NEAT) algorithm for evolving neural networks.

tools.name: tensorrvea
tools.one_line_profile: GPU-accelerated Evolutionary Multiobjective Optimization
tools.detailed_description: A GPU-accelerated framework for Evolutionary Multiobjective Optimization using Tensorized RVEA (Reference Vector Guided Evolutionary Algorithm).

tools.name: NeRF-NCNN
tools.one_line_profile: NeRF implementation in NCNN with C++ and Vulkan
tools.detailed_description: A C++ implementation of Neural Radiance Fields (NeRF) using the NCNN framework and Vulkan for efficient inference, enabling 3D scene reconstruction and rendering.

tools.name: CarpetX
tools.one_line_profile: Cactus driver for the Einstein Toolkit based on AMReX
tools.detailed_description: A driver for the Cactus computational toolkit based on the AMReX framework, enabling adaptive mesh refinement for relativistic astrophysics simulations within the Einstein Toolkit.

tools.name: AdaPT
tools.one_line_profile: Physically based mesh renderer based on Taichi lang
tools.detailed_description: A physically based path tracer (Ada Path Tracer) implemented in Taichi, designed for rendering meshes with physical accuracy.

tools.name: amr-wind
tools.one_line_profile: AMReX-based structured wind solver
tools.detailed_description: A massively parallel, block-structured adaptive mesh refinement (AMR) code for wind farm simulations, built on the AMReX library.

tools.name: BAT.py
tools.one_line_profile: Automated tool for absolute and relative binding free energy calculations
tools.detailed_description: A fully automated tool for performing absolute and relative binding free energy calculations on protein-ligand systems, compatible with AMBER and OpenMM.

tools.name: GRTeclyn
tools.one_line_profile: Port of GRChombo to AMReX for General Relativity simulations
tools.detailed_description: A numerical relativity code porting the functionality of GRChombo to the AMReX framework, enabling adaptive mesh refinement simulations of General Relativity.

tools.name: nBody
tools.one_line_profile: GPU-accelerated N-Body particle simulator with visualizer
tools.detailed_description: A GPU-accelerated N-Body particle simulator that includes a visualizer, designed for simulating gravitational or electrostatic interactions between particles.

tools.name: AToM-OpenMM
tools.one_line_profile: OpenMM-based framework for Alchemical Transfer Method free energy calculations
tools.detailed_description: A framework based on OpenMM for performing absolute and relative binding free energy calculations using the Alchemical Transfer Method (ATM).

tools.name: openmm-atmmetaforce-plugin
tools.one_line_profile: OpenMM plugin for Alchemical Transfer Potential
tools.detailed_description: An OpenMM plugin that implements the Alchemical Transfer Potential, enabling specific free energy calculation methods within OpenMM simulations.

tools.name: DiffTactile
tools.one_line_profile: Physics-based Differentiable Tactile Simulator
tools.detailed_description: A physics-based differentiable tactile simulator designed for contact-rich robotic manipulation tasks, enabling gradient-based optimization for control and perception.

tools.name: Genesis
tools.one_line_profile: Generative world for general-purpose robotics & embodied AI learning
tools.detailed_description: A simulation platform for general-purpose robotics and embodied AI, providing a generative world environment for physical simulation and learning.

tools.name: ThinShellLab
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable physics simulations for thin-shell object manipulations
tools.detailed_description: A differentiable physics simulation environment specifically designed for manipulating thin-shell objects, enabling learning and optimization for deformable object manipulation.

tools.name: GooFit
tools.one_line_profile: Massively-parallel framework for maximum-likelihood fits
tools.detailed_description: A massively-parallel framework for performing maximum-likelihood fits, implemented in CUDA and OpenMP, primarily used in High Energy Physics analysis.

tools.name: optiland
tools.one_line_profile: Optical design, optimization, and analysis tool
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive Python tool for optical design, optimization, and analysis, featuring GPU-accelerated and differentiable ray tracing via PyTorch.

tools.name: hipace
tools.one_line_profile: Highly efficient Plasma Accelerator Emulation PIC code
tools.detailed_description: A quasistatic particle-in-cell (PIC) code for highly efficient emulation of plasma accelerators.

tools.name: N-body-simulation
tools.one_line_profile: Real-time N-body simulation with Barnes-Hut and CUDA
tools.detailed_description: A real-time N-body simulation tool implementing the Barnes-Hut algorithm and accelerated with CUDA.

tools.name: athenak
tools.one_line_profile: Performance-portable astrophysical AMR-MHD code using Kokkos
tools.detailed_description: A performance-portable version of the Athena++ astrophysical adaptive mesh refinement (AMR) magnetohydrodynamics (MHD) code, rewritten using Kokkos.

tools.name: IPPL
tools.one_line_profile: C++ library for performance portable particle/grid simulations
tools.detailed_description: A C++ library designed to develop performance portable code for fully Eulerian, Lagrangian, or hybrid Eulerian-Lagrangian methods in scientific simulations.

tools.name: jaxrenderer
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable Rasteriser implemented in JAX
tools.detailed_description: A differentiable rasterizer implemented in JAX, enabling gradient-based optimization for rendering tasks, useful in inverse graphics and physics.

tools.name: PINNs-based-MPC
tools.one_line_profile: Physics-Informed Neural Networks for Model Predictive Control
tools.detailed_description: An implementation of nonlinear model predictive control (NMPC) for multi-body dynamics using Physics-Informed Neural Networks (PINNs) to approximate system dynamics.

tools.name: ExaCA
tools.one_line_profile: Cellular automata code for alloy nucleation and solidification
tools.detailed_description: A cellular automata code written with Kokkos for simulating alloy nucleation and solidification, designed for exascale computing platforms.

tools.name: ddcMD
tools.one_line_profile: GPU-accelerated molecular dynamics for Martini force field
tools.detailed_description: A fully GPU-accelerated molecular dynamics program specifically optimized for the Martini coarse-grained force field.

tools.name: exadis
tools.one_line_profile: Exascale Dislocation Simulator for Discrete Dislocation Dynamics
tools.detailed_description: A portable library for Discrete Dislocation Dynamics (DDD) simulations that runs on GPUs, designed for exascale materials science simulations.

tools.name: SIMULATeQCD
tools.one_line_profile: Multi-GPU Lattice QCD framework
tools.detailed_description: A multi-GPU Lattice QCD framework designed to make it easy for physicists to implement lattice QCD formulas while providing competitive performance.

tools.name: SevenNet
tools.one_line_profile: Graph neural network interatomic potential for multi-GPU MD simulations
tools.detailed_description: SevenNet is a graph neural network interatomic potential package designed for efficient multi-GPU parallel molecular dynamics simulations, enabling large-scale and long-time simulations of materials.

tools.name: MFC
tools.one_line_profile: Exascale simulation framework for multiphase fluid dynamics
tools.detailed_description: MFC (Multi-Component Flow Code) is an open-source high-order solver for multiphase, compressible, and reacting flows, designed for exascale high-performance computing systems.

tools.name: pytorch-softdtw-cuda
tools.one_line_profile: Fast CUDA implementation of SoftDTW for PyTorch
tools.detailed_description: A highly optimized CUDA implementation of Soft Dynamic Time Warping (SoftDTW) for PyTorch, enabling differentiable time series alignment and analysis on GPUs.

tools.name: pytim
tools.one_line_profile: Interfacial analysis of molecular simulations
tools.detailed_description: Pytim is a Python package based on MDAnalysis for the identification and analysis of fluid interfaces in molecular simulations, supporting various surface identification algorithms.

tools.name: pycharge
tools.one_line_profile: Electromagnetics simulation library for moving point charges
tools.detailed_description: PyCharge is a Python library built on JAX for simulating the electromagnetic fields and potentials generated by moving point charges, supporting differentiable simulations.

tools.name: torchoptics
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable wave optics simulation library
tools.detailed_description: TorchOptics is a differentiable wave optics simulation library built on PyTorch, enabling gradient-based optimization and simulation of optical systems.

tools.name: gamd-openmm
tools.one_line_profile: Gaussian Accelerated Molecular Dynamics for OpenMM
tools.detailed_description: A Python implementation of Gaussian Accelerated Molecular Dynamics (GaMD) for the OpenMM toolkit, facilitating unconstrained enhanced sampling and free energy calculations.

tools.name: SolvationToolkit
tools.one_line_profile: Tools for setting up solute-solvent mixtures for MD
tools.detailed_description: A toolkit for automating the setup of arbitrary solute-solvent mixtures for molecular dynamics simulations, compatible with GROMACS, Amber, and OpenMM.

tools.name: NVIDIA Warp
tools.one_line_profile: Python framework for high-performance simulation and graphics
tools.detailed_description: Warp is a Python framework that provides a high-performance JIT compiler for writing differentiable graphics and physics simulation kernels that run on the GPU.

tools.name: ProtoMotions
tools.one_line_profile: GPU-accelerated simulation for digital humans and robots
tools.detailed_description: ProtoMotions is a GPU-accelerated simulation and learning framework designed for training physically simulated digital humans and humanoid robots using reinforcement learning.

tools.name: feax
tools.one_line_profile: JAX-based finite element analysis engine
tools.detailed_description: feax is a compact, high-performance finite element analysis (FEA) engine built on JAX, enabling differentiable structural analysis and optimization.

tools.name: CabanaPD
tools.one_line_profile: Peridynamics simulation with Cabana library
tools.detailed_description: CabanaPD is a library for peridynamics simulations implemented using the Cabana performance portability library, designed for particle-based fracture and mechanics simulations on HPC systems.

tools.name: PHARE
tools.one_line_profile: Parallel Hybrid Particle-In-Cell code with AMR
tools.detailed_description: PHARE is a parallel hybrid Particle-In-Cell (PIC) code featuring Adaptive Mesh Refinement (AMR), designed for simulating space plasmas and astrophysical phenomena.

tools.name: pennylane-lightning-kokkos
tools.one_line_profile: Kokkos-enabled Lightning simulator for PennyLane
tools.detailed_description: A high-performance state-vector simulator for the PennyLane quantum machine learning library, utilizing Kokkos for parallel execution on various hardware backends (CPU/GPU).

tools.name: phasicFlow
tools.one_line_profile: Parallel DEM and CFD-DEM simulation code
tools.detailed_description: phasicFlow is a parallel, high-efficiency code for Discrete Element Method (DEM) and coupled CFD-DEM simulations of granular and multiphase flows on CPUs and GPUs.

tools.name: openLBMPM
tools.one_line_profile: LBM package for multicomponent/multiphase flow in porous media
tools.detailed_description: openLBMPM is an open-source Lattice Boltzmann Method (LBM) package specifically designed for simulating multicomponent and multiphase flow and transport in porous media using CUDA acceleration.

tools.name: pressio-rom
tools.one_line_profile: Library for reduced order modeling and solvers
tools.detailed_description: pressio-rom is a C++ library providing infrastructure for reduced order modeling (ROM), including linear/non-linear solvers and time integration schemes, designed for performance portability.

tools.name: SPECFEMPP
tools.one_line_profile: C++ rewrite of the SPECFEM seismic wave simulation suite
tools.detailed_description: SPECFEM++ is a modern C++ implementation of the SPECFEM suite for simulating seismic wave propagation, aiming for high performance and modularity in geophysics simulations.

tools.name: FluidX3D
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance Lattice Boltzmann CFD software
tools.detailed_description: FluidX3D is a highly optimized Lattice Boltzmann Method (LBM) CFD software that runs on GPUs via OpenCL, offering fast and memory-efficient fluid simulations.

tools.name: beamz
tools.one_line_profile: Electromagnetic simulation and inverse design tool
tools.detailed_description: beamz is a Python library for fast electromagnetic simulation and inverse design, utilizing JAX for differentiability and acceleration.

tools.name: torch-diffsim
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable physics simulator in PyTorch
tools.detailed_description: A minimal, parallelizable physics simulator supporting differentiation entirely within PyTorch, suitable for learning-based control and physical parameter estimation.

tools.name: pumi-pic
tools.one_line_profile: Unstructured mesh support for PIC simulations
tools.detailed_description: pumi-pic provides support libraries for performing Particle-In-Cell (PIC) simulations on unstructured meshes, optimized for GPUs and CPUs.

tools.name: PySAGES
tools.one_line_profile: Python suite for advanced general ensemble simulations
tools.detailed_description: PySAGES is a Python-based suite for performing advanced sampling in molecular dynamics simulations, offering a flexible interface for defining collective variables and sampling methods.

tools.name: SSAGES
tools.one_line_profile: Software Suite for Advanced General Ensemble Simulations
tools.detailed_description: SSAGES is an open-source engine for advanced sampling in molecular dynamics simulations. It couples with various MD engines (like LAMMPS, GROMACS, OpenMD) to perform enhanced sampling methods such as metadynamics, umbrella sampling, and forward flux sampling.

tools.name: hpx-kokkos
tools.one_line_profile: Interoperability library for HPX and Kokkos
tools.detailed_description: A library that enables the interoperability between HPX (a C++ standard library for concurrency and parallelism) and Kokkos (a performance portability ecosystem). It allows scientific applications to leverage asynchronous task-based parallelism alongside performance-portable kernels.

tools.name: Octo-Tiger
tools.one_line_profile: Astrophysics simulation code using fast multipole method on adaptive Octrees
tools.detailed_description: An astrophysics code for simulating the evolution of star systems (like binary star mergers). It uses the Fast Multipole Method (FMM) on adaptive Octrees and is optimized for HPC systems using HPX for parallelism.

tools.name: SWIFT
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance particle-based astrophysics and cosmology simulation code
tools.detailed_description: SWIFT is a hydrodynamics and gravity code for astrophysics and cosmology. It uses task-based parallelism to scale efficiently on supercomputers and simulates phenomena like galaxy formation and dark matter evolution.

tools.name: Simple Simulator
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance physics simulator for robotics and manipulation
tools.detailed_description: A physics simulator designed for robotics research, focusing on simplicity and performance. It supports rigid body dynamics and is used for testing control algorithms and robot learning.

tools.name: Smilei
tools.one_line_profile: Particle-in-Cell (PIC) code for plasma simulation
tools.detailed_description: Smilei is a collaborative, open-source Particle-in-Cell (PIC) code for plasma physics simulations. It is designed for high-performance computing and supports various physics modules for laser-plasma interaction and astrophysics.

tools.name: MuJoCo-LiDAR
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance LiDAR simulation for MuJoCo
tools.detailed_description: A high-performance LiDAR simulation tool based on the MuJoCo physics engine. It supports multiple backends (CPU, Taichi, Jax) and integrates with ROS, enabling realistic sensor simulation for robotics research.

tools.name: skrl
tools.one_line_profile: Modular Reinforcement Learning library for robotics and physics simulations
tools.detailed_description: skrl is a reinforcement learning library designed for modularity and readability. It supports PyTorch, JAX, and integrates with physics-based environments like NVIDIA Isaac Lab, Omniverse, and MuJoCo for robot learning.

tools.name: TIES_MD
tools.one_line_profile: Binding free energy calculations using TIES protocol
tools.detailed_description: A Python package built on NAMD/OpenMM to perform binding free energy calculations using the Thermodynamic Integration with Enhanced Sampling (TIES) protocol. It automates the setup and analysis of alchemical free energy simulations.

tools.name: BabelStream
tools.one_line_profile: Memory bandwidth benchmark for diverse HPC architectures
tools.detailed_description: BabelStream is a benchmark tool for measuring memory transfer rates (bandwidth) across a wide range of processing devices (CPUs, GPUs) and programming models (CUDA, OpenCL, Kokkos, SYCL, etc.). It is essential for evaluating hardware performance for scientific computing.

tools.name: PararealML
tools.one_line_profile: Machine learning boosted parallel-in-time differential equation solver
tools.detailed_description: A framework that implements the Parareal algorithm (parallel-in-time integration) augmented with machine learning surrogates to accelerate the solution of differential equations.

tools.name: IonSolver
tools.one_line_profile: Magnetohydrodynamic simulation software using Lattice Boltzmann method
tools.detailed_description: IonSolver is a simulation tool for magnetohydrodynamics (MHD) utilizing an extended Lattice Boltzmann method (LBM) with GPU acceleration capabilities.

tools.name: viskores
tools.one_line_profile: Visualization library for many-threaded devices
tools.detailed_description: A visualization library designed for high-performance, many-threaded devices (like GPUs), enabling in-situ visualization for scientific simulations.

tools.name: SPHinXsys
tools.one_line_profile: Multi-physics simulation library based on Smoothed Particle Hydrodynamics
tools.detailed_description: SPHinXsys is a C++ library for multi-physics simulations using Smoothed Particle Hydrodynamics (SPH). It handles fluid dynamics, solid mechanics, and fluid-structure interactions in a unified framework.

tools.name: Lattice-Boltzmann-Method-GPU
tools.one_line_profile: GPU-accelerated 3D Lattice Boltzmann CFD solver
tools.detailed_description: A CUDA-based Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) solver implementing the Lattice Boltzmann Method (LBM) for 3D single-phase flows, offering significant speedup over CPU implementations.

tools.name: GeoTaichi
tools.one_line_profile: Taichi-powered simulator for geophysical problems
tools.detailed_description: A high-performance numerical simulator built with Taichi, designed for solving multiscale and multifield geophysical problems.

tools.name: OpenABC
tools.one_line_profile: OpenMM implementation of coarse-grained protein models
tools.detailed_description: A Python package providing OpenMM implementations of various coarse-grained models (MOFF, MRG-CG, HPS) for simulating biomolecular condensates and proteins.

tools.name: py-sphviewer
tools.one_line_profile: SPH rendering framework for cosmological simulations
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for rendering and visualizing Smoothed Particle Hydrodynamics (SPH) data, particularly useful for cosmological simulations.

tools.name: gpu-io
tools.one_line_profile: GPU-accelerated physics simulation library for the web
tools.detailed_description: A library for performing GPU-accelerated physics simulations and mathematical computations directly in a web browser, supporting fluid dynamics, reaction-diffusion, and particle systems.

tools.name: jaxsim
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable physics engine and multibody dynamics library in JAX
tools.detailed_description: A differentiable physics engine implemented in JAX, designed for robot learning and control. It allows for gradient-based optimization of multibody dynamics.

tools.name: ArborX
tools.one_line_profile: Performance-portable geometric search library for HPC
tools.detailed_description: ArborX is a library for geometric search (e.g., bounding volume hierarchies, nearest neighbor search) designed for high-performance computing applications. It supports various backends (CUDA, HIP, Kokkos) for acceleration.

tools.name: pinnfactory
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for Physics-Informed Neural Networks (PINNs)
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight framework for building and training Physics-Informed Neural Networks (PINNs). It integrates symbolic PDE definitions with PyTorch's automatic differentiation to solve forward and inverse physics problems.

tools.name: rakau
tools.one_line_profile: C++17 N-body Barnes-Hut library for heterogeneous hardware architectures
tools.detailed_description: A C++17 library implementing the Barnes-Hut N-body algorithm, designed for high performance on heterogeneous hardware architectures including CPUs and GPUs.

tools.name: SciBmad.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Julia interface for the Bmad accelerator physics simulation library
tools.detailed_description: A modular, polymorphic, and differentiable accelerator physics code in Julia, providing portability across CPU and GPU architectures as part of the Bmad ecosystem.

tools.name: GPUMD
tools.one_line_profile: General-purpose molecular dynamics simulation package for GPUs
tools.detailed_description: A highly efficient molecular dynamics simulation package designed specifically for Graphics Processing Units (GPUs), enabling large-scale atomistic simulations.

tools.name: OpenMM-Python-Force
tools.one_line_profile: Plugin to define OpenMM forces using arbitrary Python code
tools.detailed_description: A facility allowing users to define custom forces for OpenMM molecular dynamics simulations using pure Python code, facilitating rapid prototyping and complex force field implementation.

tools.name: Celeritas
tools.one_line_profile: GPU-accelerated Monte Carlo transport code for high energy physics
tools.detailed_description: A Monte Carlo transport code designed to accelerate high energy physics detector simulations by leveraging GPUs for improved throughput and energy efficiency.

tools.name: openmmtools
tools.one_line_profile: Toolkit for OpenMM molecular simulation engine
tools.detailed_description: A batteries-included toolkit providing additional integrators, test systems, and utilities for the GPU-accelerated OpenMM molecular simulation engine.

tools.name: perses
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for alchemical free energy calculations and chemical space exploration
tools.detailed_description: A Python framework for performing alchemical free energy calculations and exploring chemical space using expanded ensembles, built on top of OpenMM.

tools.name: Yank
tools.one_line_profile: GPU-accelerated Python framework for alchemical free energy calculations
tools.detailed_description: An open, extensible Python framework for performing efficient, GPU-accelerated alchemical free energy calculations for ligand binding and hydration.

tools.name: flowerMD
tools.one_line_profile: Workflow library for organic molecular dynamics simulations
tools.detailed_description: A flexible library for defining and executing organic molecular dynamics workflows and recipes, facilitating reproducible simulations.

tools.name: ufedmm
tools.one_line_profile: Unified Free Energy Dynamics (UFED) implementation for OpenMM
tools.detailed_description: A Python library implementing Unified Free Energy Dynamics (UFED) for enhanced sampling simulations using the OpenMM engine.

tools.name: MonoForce
tools.one_line_profile: Learnable image-conditioned physics engine for robot-terrain interaction
tools.detailed_description: A differentiable physics engine designed to predict robot-terrain interactions by fusing RGB and LiDAR data, enabling learnable physical modeling for robotics.

tools.name: evoxels
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable physics framework for voxel-based microstructure simulations
tools.detailed_description: A differentiable physics framework specifically designed for simulating voxel-based microstructures, enabling gradient-based optimization of material properties.

tools.name: Dojo.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable physics engine for robotics in Julia
tools.detailed_description: A differentiable physics engine written in Julia, designed for robotics simulation and control, supporting gradient-based optimization.

tools.name: ppiclF
tools.one_line_profile: Parallel Particle-in-Cell (PIC) library in Fortran
tools.detailed_description: A Fortran library for implementing parallel Particle-in-Cell (PIC) methods, facilitating high-performance plasma and fluid simulations.

tools.name: nbody
tools.one_line_profile: N-body gravity attraction problem solver
tools.detailed_description: A C++ solver for the N-body gravity attraction problem, suitable for simulating gravitational interactions in astrophysical systems.

tools.name: ParticleSolver
tools.one_line_profile: CPU and GPU particle-based physics simulation library
tools.detailed_description: A library providing CPU and GPU implementations of particle-based physics simulations, based on the Unified Particle Physics for Real-Time Application method.

tools.name: entity
tools.one_line_profile: Astrophysical plasma simulation code with CPU/GPU portability
tools.detailed_description: A next-generation simulation code for astrophysical plasmas, featuring performance portability across CPUs and GPUs.

tools.name: ERF
tools.one_line_profile: Energy Research and Forecasting Model
tools.detailed_description: A modeling system for energy research and forecasting, designed to simulate atmospheric flows and their interaction with energy systems.

tools.name: SPH_Taichi
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance Smoothed Particle Hydrodynamics (SPH) implementation in Taichi
tools.detailed_description: A high-performance implementation of the Smoothed Particle Hydrodynamics (SPH) method using the Taichi programming language, enabling efficient fluid simulations on GPUs.

tools.name: Tiny Differentiable Simulator
tools.one_line_profile: Header-only C++ and CUDA differentiable physics library
tools.detailed_description: A zero-dependency, header-only C++ and CUDA physics library designed for reinforcement learning and robotics, supporting differentiable simulation.

tools.name: grand
tools.one_line_profile: GCMC sampling module for OpenMM
tools.detailed_description: A Python module for performing Grand Canonical Monte Carlo (GCMC) insertions and deletions of water molecules within OpenMM simulations.

tools.name: tmLQCD
tools.one_line_profile: Lattice QCD simulation software suite
tools.detailed_description: A software suite for Lattice QCD simulations, implementing HMC and various fermion actions, fully parallelized for modern HPC architectures.

tools.name: FBPIC
tools.one_line_profile: Spectral, quasi-3D Particle-In-Cell code for plasma physics on CPU and GPU
tools.detailed_description: FBPIC is a Particle-In-Cell (PIC) code for relativistic plasma physics. It features a spectral cylindrical representation that allows for accurate and fast simulations, particularly suitable for laser-wakefield acceleration and plasma-based accelerators.

tools.name: fdtd
tools.one_line_profile: 3D electromagnetic FDTD simulator written in Python
tools.detailed_description: A Python-based 3D electromagnetic Finite-Difference Time-Domain (FDTD) simulator. It provides a simple interface for defining geometries, sources, and detectors to simulate electromagnetic wave propagation, with optional GPU acceleration via PyTorch.

tools.name: Synergia
tools.one_line_profile: Accelerator modeling and simulation package
tools.detailed_description: Synergia is a package for the modeling and simulation of particle accelerators, developed at Fermilab. It handles single-particle optics and collective effects like space charge and impedance in a parallel computing environment.

tools.name: GSD
tools.one_line_profile: File format library for HOOMD-blue data
tools.detailed_description: GSD (General Simulation Data) is a file format specification and library for reading and writing simulation data, primarily designed for and used by the HOOMD-blue molecular dynamics engine. It handles efficient storage of particle trajectories and properties.

tools.name: HOOMD-blue
tools.one_line_profile: General-purpose particle simulation toolkit optimized for GPUs
tools.detailed_description: HOOMD-blue is a general-purpose particle simulation toolkit. It performs molecular dynamics and Monte Carlo simulations of particles on CPUs and GPUs, designed for high performance and scalability in soft matter research.

tools.name: MuJoCo Warp
tools.one_line_profile: GPU-optimized version of the MuJoCo physics simulator
tools.detailed_description: A version of the MuJoCo physics engine optimized for NVIDIA GPUs using the Warp library. It enables massive parallelism for rigid body dynamics simulations, particularly useful for reinforcement learning and robotics research.

tools.name: Brax
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable physics engine for massive parallel simulation on accelerators
tools.detailed_description: Brax is a differentiable physics engine that simulates massive numbers of environments in parallel on hardware accelerators (GPUs/TPUs). It is designed for reinforcement learning and evolutionary algorithms, enabling rapid training of agents in physics-based environments.

tools.name: Grappa
tools.one_line_profile: Machine learned Molecular Mechanics force field
tools.detailed_description: Grappa is a machine-learned molecular mechanics force field that integrates with GROMACS and OpenMM. It aims to improve the accuracy of molecular dynamics simulations by using machine learning to parameterize force fields.

tools.name: Runko
tools.one_line_profile: Modern C++/Python CPU/GPU plasma physics toolbox
tools.detailed_description: Runko is a computational toolbox for plasma physics simulations. It supports multi-dimensional kinetic plasma simulations on CPUs and GPUs, providing a flexible framework for studying astrophysical and laboratory plasmas.

tools.name: PlasticineLab
tools.one_line_profile: Soft-Body Manipulation Benchmark with Differentiable Physics
tools.detailed_description: PlasticineLab is a benchmark suite and simulation environment for soft-body manipulation tasks. It utilizes differentiable physics to enable gradient-based optimization and reinforcement learning for controlling deformable objects.

tools.name: Idefix
tools.one_line_profile: Performance-portable finite volume code for astrophysical fluid dynamics
tools.detailed_description: Idefix is a finite volume code designed for astrophysical fluid dynamics simulations. It uses Kokkos to achieve performance portability across various architectures (CPU, GPU) and supports hydrodynamics and magnetohydrodynamics (MHD).

tools.name: Stannum
tools.one_line_profile: Bridge library fusing Taichi into PyTorch for differentiable physics
tools.detailed_description: Stannum is a library that enables the integration of Taichi kernels into PyTorch's autograd graph. This allows researchers to build differentiable physics pipelines where Taichi handles the simulation and PyTorch handles the learning and optimization.

tools.name: ommprotocol
tools.one_line_profile: CLI application to launch OpenMM molecular dynamics simulations
tools.detailed_description: ommprotocol is a command-line tool that simplifies the process of running molecular dynamics simulations using the OpenMM engine. It provides a structured way to define simulation protocols and execute them without writing custom Python scripts.

tools.name: NVIDIA Isaac Sim
tools.one_line_profile: Robotics simulation and synthetic data generation tool
tools.detailed_description: NVIDIA Isaac Sim is a scalable robotics simulation application and synthetic data generation tool. It leverages GPU acceleration and physics simulation to create photorealistic, physically accurate virtual environments for developing and testing robots.

tools.name: JAX-MD
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable, hardware-accelerated molecular dynamics in JAX
tools.detailed_description: JAX-MD is a software package for performing molecular dynamics simulations using JAX. It is fully differentiable and runs on hardware accelerators (GPUs/TPUs), enabling research into machine-learned potentials and optimization of physical systems.

tools.name: Metadynamics Plugin
tools.one_line_profile: Metadynamics plugin for HOOMD-blue
tools.detailed_description: A plugin for the HOOMD-blue simulation engine that implements metadynamics, an enhanced sampling technique. It allows users to perform free energy calculations and explore rare events in molecular simulations.

tools.name: Kokkos
tools.one_line_profile: C++ Performance Portability Programming Ecosystem for HPC
tools.detailed_description: A production-level C++ programming model for writing performance portable applications targeting all major HPC platforms (CPU, GPU, etc.). It provides abstractions for parallel execution and memory management.

tools.name: Kokkos Comm
tools.one_line_profile: Experimental Explicit Communications API for Kokkos
tools.detailed_description: An experimental library providing explicit communication interfaces (like MPI) integrated within the Kokkos ecosystem for distributed memory parallelism.

tools.name: Kokkos FFT
tools.one_line_profile: Shared-memory FFT library for the Kokkos ecosystem
tools.detailed_description: A Fast Fourier Transform (FFT) library designed to work seamlessly with Kokkos views and execution spaces, enabling portable spectral analysis on CPUs and GPUs.

tools.name: Kokkos Fortran Interop
tools.one_line_profile: Interoperability tools for Fortran and Kokkos C++
tools.detailed_description: A library facilitating the integration of modern C++ Kokkos performance kernels into legacy or mixed-language Fortran scientific applications.

tools.name: Kokkos Kernels
tools.one_line_profile: Math Kernels for Kokkos (BLAS, Sparse, Graph)
tools.detailed_description: A collection of performance-portable mathematical kernels including dense BLAS, sparse linear algebra, and graph algorithms, optimized for various HPC architectures via Kokkos.

tools.name: Kokkos Remote Spaces
tools.one_line_profile: Distributed View Extension for Kokkos
tools.detailed_description: An extension to Kokkos providing Partitioned Global Address Space (PGAS) capabilities, allowing Kokkos Views to span across distributed memory nodes.

tools.name: Kokkos Tools
tools.one_line_profile: Profiling and Debugging Tools for Kokkos
tools.detailed_description: A suite of tools for profiling, debugging, and tuning Kokkos-based applications, providing insights into kernel performance and memory usage.

tools.name: PyKokkos
tools.one_line_profile: Performance portable parallel programming in Python backed by Kokkos
tools.detailed_description: A Python framework that enables performance-portable parallel programming by generating and compiling Kokkos C++ code at runtime, bridging Python ease-of-use with HPC performance.

tools.name: PyKokkos Base
tools.one_line_profile: Python bindings for data interoperability with Kokkos
tools.detailed_description: The base library for PyKokkos, providing Python bindings for Kokkos data structures (Views) to enable efficient data exchange between Python and C++.

tools.name: LAMMPS
tools.one_line_profile: Large-scale Atomic/Molecular Massively Parallel Simulator
tools.detailed_description: A classical molecular dynamics code with a focus on materials modeling. It's designed to run efficiently on parallel computers and supports a wide range of interatomic potentials and boundary conditions.

tools.name: MATAR
tools.one_line_profile: Portable dense and sparse data representations using Kokkos
tools.detailed_description: A C++ library from LANL that simplifies the creation of dense and sparse data structures (matrices, tensors) that are portable across different hardware architectures using Kokkos.

tools.name: VPIC-Kokkos
tools.one_line_profile: Kokkos port of the VPIC plasma physics code
tools.detailed_description: A performance-portable version of the Vector Particle-In-Cell (VPIC) code, used for simulating plasma physics phenomena on supercomputers.

tools.name: FleCSPH
tools.one_line_profile: Parallel and Distributed SPH Implementation Based on FleCSI
tools.detailed_description: A Smoothed Particle Hydrodynamics (SPH) solver built on top of the FleCSI topology framework, designed for parallel and distributed simulations of fluids and astrophysics.

tools.name: QUDA
tools.one_line_profile: Library for performing calculations in lattice QCD on GPUs
tools.detailed_description: A library for Lattice Quantum Chromodynamics (QCD) that provides optimized solvers for linear systems on NVIDIA GPUs, widely used in high-energy physics.

tools.name: OPLSAA-DB
tools.one_line_profile: Database of OPLS-AA parameters and topologies
tools.detailed_description: A curated database containing hand-built OPLS-AA force field parameters and topologies for over 400 molecules, compatible with major MD engines like GROMACS, LAMMPS, and OpenMM.

tools.name: lcp-physics
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable LCP physics engine in PyTorch
tools.detailed_description: A differentiable physics engine based on Linear Complementarity Problems (LCP), integrated with PyTorch to enable learning of physical parameters and control policies.

tools.name: PeTar
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance N-body code for star clusters
tools.detailed_description: A high-performance N-body simulation code designed for modeling the evolution of star clusters and tidal streams, handling binaries and hierarchical systems with galactic potentials.

tools.name: CMBLensing.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable and GPU-compatible toolkit for CMB analysis
tools.detailed_description: A Julia package for analysis of the Cosmic Microwave Background (CMB) lensing, featuring automatic differentiation and GPU acceleration for cosmological inference.

tools.name: gpu-physics
tools.one_line_profile: Python framework for warp-based simulations on GPU
tools.detailed_description: A framework leveraging NVIDIA Warp for writing high-performance physics simulations in Python, running on GPUs with visualization capabilities.

tools.name: FLARE
tools.one_line_profile: Fast Learning of Atomistic Rare Events
tools.detailed_description: An open-source Python package for creating fast and accurate interatomic potentials using machine learning (Gaussian Processes), enabling efficient molecular dynamics simulations.

tools.name: pair_nequip_allegro
tools.one_line_profile: LAMMPS pair styles for NequIP and Allegro potentials
tools.detailed_description: A plugin for LAMMPS that enables the use of deep learning interatomic potentials (NequIP and Allegro) within standard molecular dynamics simulations.

tools.name: GPUE
tools.one_line_profile: GPU Gross-Pitaevskii Equation numerical solver
tools.detailed_description: A CUDA-accelerated numerical solver for the Gross-Pitaevskii Equation, used to simulate the dynamics of Bose-Einstein condensates (BECs) and quantum fluids.

tools.name: FEMcy
tools.one_line_profile: Parallel Finite Element Solver based on Taichi
tools.detailed_description: A portable and parallel Finite Element Method (FEM) solver implemented in Python using the Taichi programming language, supporting CPU and GPU execution.

tools.name: Polycrystal-PhaseField
tools.one_line_profile: Phase-field simulation of grain growth in polycrystals
tools.detailed_description: A multi-phase field simulation code for modeling grain growth in polycrystalline materials, implemented in Taichi for cross-platform parallel acceleration.

tools.name: psiflow
tools.one_line_profile: Scalable molecular simulation workflow
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for orchestrating scalable molecular simulations, integrating quantum chemistry calculations with machine learning potential training and execution.

tools.name: Morpheus (Sparse)
tools.one_line_profile: Dynamic matrix type and algorithms for sparse matrices
tools.detailed_description: A C++ library providing dynamic sparse matrix data structures and algorithms, facilitating efficient linear algebra operations in scientific computing applications.

tools.name: azplugins
tools.one_line_profile: Additional plugins for the HOOMD-blue simulation engine
tools.detailed_description: A component for HOOMD-blue that provides additional potentials, updaters, and other features for soft matter simulations, extending the core capabilities of the engine.

tools.name: gsd-vmd
tools.one_line_profile: VMD plugin for reading HOOMD-blue GSD files
tools.detailed_description: A molfile plugin for Visual Molecular Dynamics (VMD) that enables the reading and visualization of GSD (General Simulation Data) files generated by HOOMD-blue.

tools.name: YAKL
tools.one_line_profile: C++ portability framework for HPC applications
tools.detailed_description: YAKL (Yet Another Kokkos Layer) is a simple C++ framework designed to facilitate performance portability and the porting of Fortran code to C++ for high-performance computing applications, often used in weather and climate modeling.

tools.name: hamilton
tools.one_line_profile: Physics simulation using Hamiltonian Mechanics and AD
tools.detailed_description: A library to simulate physics on generalized coordinate systems using Hamiltonian Mechanics and automatic differentiation, allowing for flexible definition of physical systems.

tools.name: mjlab
tools.one_line_profile: Isaac Lab API powered by MuJoCo-Warp for robotics
tools.detailed_description: A framework for reinforcement learning and robotics research that provides an Isaac Lab API powered by MuJoCo-Warp, facilitating physics-based simulation and training.

tools.name: mdapy
tools.one_line_profile: Library for handling molecular dynamics simulation data
tools.detailed_description: A simple and fast Python library designed to handle and analyze data generated from molecular dynamics simulations, supporting various formats and analysis tasks.

tools.name: swSim
tools.one_line_profile: GPU-accelerated solid wave simulation for NDE
tools.detailed_description: Solid Wave Simulation (swSim) solves heterogeneous, anisotropic elastodynamic equations for ultrasonic Non-Destructive Evaluation (NDE) simulation using a time-explicit staggered grid finite difference scheme on GPUs.

tools.name: newton
tools.one_line_profile: GPU-accelerated physics engine for robotics
tools.detailed_description: An open-source, GPU-accelerated physics simulation engine built upon NVIDIA Warp, specifically targeting roboticists and simulation researchers for high-performance physical simulation.

tools.name: openawsem
tools.one_line_profile: AWSEM coarse-grained protein folding in OpenMM
tools.detailed_description: An implementation of the AWSEM (Associative memory, Water mediated, Structure and Energy Model) coarse-grained protein folding forcefield within the OpenMM framework.

tools.name: openff-evaluator
tools.one_line_profile: Physical property evaluation toolkit
tools.detailed_description: A toolkit from the Open Forcefield Consortium for evaluating physical properties of molecular systems, automating the setup and execution of simulations to estimate thermodynamic properties.

tools.name: openff-interchange
tools.one_line_profile: Molecular mechanics data interchange tool
tools.detailed_description: A project for storing, manipulating, and converting molecular mechanics data, facilitating interoperability between different simulation engines and force field formats.

tools.name: openff-toolkit
tools.one_line_profile: Open Forcefield Toolkit for SMIRNOFF parameters
tools.detailed_description: The Open Forcefield Toolkit provides implementations of the SMIRNOFF force field format, a parameterization engine, and tools for applying force fields to small molecules.

tools.name: OpenMM
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance GPU molecular simulation toolkit
tools.detailed_description: OpenMM is a toolkit for molecular simulation using high-performance GPU code, providing a flexible API for defining custom forces and integrators for molecular dynamics.

tools.name: openmm-ml
tools.one_line_profile: Machine learning model interface for OpenMM
tools.detailed_description: A high-level API for using machine learning models (such as neural network potentials) within OpenMM simulations, bridging ML potentials with classical MD.

tools.name: openmm-plumed
tools.one_line_profile: OpenMM interface for PLUMED
tools.detailed_description: A plugin that connects OpenMM with PLUMED, enabling enhanced sampling methods and the calculation of collective variables during molecular dynamics simulations.

tools.name: openmm-setup
tools.one_line_profile: GUI application for configuring OpenMM simulations
tools.detailed_description: A graphical application that assists users in preparing, configuring, and running molecular dynamics simulations with OpenMM, simplifying the setup process.

tools.name: openmm-tensorflow
tools.one_line_profile: TensorFlow interface for OpenMM forces
tools.detailed_description: An OpenMM plugin that allows users to define forces and potential energy functions using TensorFlow neural networks, enabling the use of ML models in MD simulations.

tools.name: openmm-torch
tools.one_line_profile: PyTorch interface for OpenMM forces
tools.detailed_description: An OpenMM plugin that allows users to define forces and potential energy functions using PyTorch models, facilitating the integration of deep learning potentials into MD simulations.

tools.name: openmmforcefields
tools.one_line_profile: AMBER and CHARMM force fields for OpenMM
tools.detailed_description: A collection of AMBER and CHARMM force fields packaged for use with OpenMM, including support for small molecules via GAFF and other parameters.

tools.name: xrtailor
tools.one_line_profile: GPU Cloth Simulation Engine
tools.detailed_description: A GPU-accelerated cloth simulation engine from OpenXRLab, designed for high-performance physical simulation of fabrics and clothing.

tools.name: athenapk
tools.one_line_profile: Performance portable Athena++ on Parthenon/Kokkos
tools.detailed_description: A performance-portable version of the Athena++ astrophysical magnetohydrodynamics (MHD) code, built on the Parthenon AMR infrastructure and Kokkos for GPU acceleration.

tools.name: parthenon
tools.one_line_profile: Performance portable AMR infrastructure
tools.detailed_description: A performance-portable Adaptive Mesh Refinement (AMR) infrastructure derived from Athena++, designed to support block-structured mesh simulations on various hardware architectures using Kokkos.

tools.name: StellarSolver
tools.one_line_profile: High-Performance N-Body Simulation with CUDA
tools.detailed_description: A high-performance N-Body simulation tool implementing the Barnes-Hut algorithm with CUDA acceleration for simulating gravitational interactions in large systems.

tools.name: xpag
tools.one_line_profile: Modular reinforcement learning library with JAX
tools.detailed_description: A modular reinforcement learning library featuring JAX-based agents, designed for flexibility and performance in research involving control and simulation tasks.

tools.name: phoebe
tools.one_line_profile: Solver for phonon and electron Boltzmann equations
tools.detailed_description: A high-performance framework for solving phonon and electron Boltzmann transport equations to calculate transport properties of materials.

tools.name: euler2d_kokkos
tools.one_line_profile: 2D Euler equations solver using Kokkos
tools.detailed_description: A finite volume solver for 2D Euler equations implemented using the Kokkos library for performance portability across CPU and GPU architectures.

tools.name: euler_kokkos
tools.one_line_profile: Compressible hydro/MHD solver with MPI+Kokkos
tools.detailed_description: A compressible hydrodynamics and magneto-hydrodynamics (MHD) solver using a 2nd order Godunov method, implemented with MPI and Kokkos for parallel execution.

tools.name: ppkMHD
tools.one_line_profile: Spectral difference MHD solver with MPI+Kokkos
tools.detailed_description: An implementation of high-order spectral difference methods (SDM) for Magneto-Hydrodynamics (MHD), utilizing MPI and Kokkos for high-performance computing.

tools.name: dtw
tools.one_line_profile: Dynamic Time Warping Python module
tools.detailed_description: A Python implementation of Dynamic Time Warping (DTW), a standard algorithm for measuring similarity between two temporal sequences, widely used in scientific data analysis and robotics.

tools.name: VectorizedMultiAgentSimulator
tools.one_line_profile: Vectorized differentiable simulator for MARL
tools.detailed_description: VMAS is a vectorized, differentiable 2D physics engine and simulator designed for efficient benchmarking of Multi-Agent Reinforcement Learning (MARL) algorithms.

tools.name: pypose
tools.one_line_profile: Library for differentiable robotics on manifolds
tools.detailed_description: A PyTorch-based library for differentiable robotics that connects deep learning with physics-based optimization on manifolds, facilitating robot control and state estimation.

tools.name: Dock-MD-FEP
tools.one_line_profile: Automated workflow for protein-ligand binding free energy calculations
tools.detailed_description: An all-in-one workflow for automated binding free energy calculations between proteins and small molecules using OpenMM. It streamlines the process of Docking, Molecular Dynamics (MD), and Free Energy Perturbation (FEP).

tools.name: Quokka
tools.one_line_profile: Two-moment AMR radiation hydrodynamics code for astrophysics
tools.detailed_description: A block-structured Adaptive Mesh Refinement (AMR) radiation hydrodynamics code that runs on CPUs and GPUs. It includes self-gravity, particles, chemistry, and magnetic fields, designed for high-performance astrophysical simulations.

tools.name: Simba-PS
tools.one_line_profile: Fast deterministic Lennard-Jones particle simulator
tools.detailed_description: A Python-based Lennard-Jones particle simulator that utilizes Numba for GPU-accelerated computation. It focuses on deterministic simulation of particle dynamics.

tools.name: PyASFLIP
tools.one_line_profile: Python implementation of the ASFLIP advection method
tools.detailed_description: A Python implementation of the Affine Particle-In-Cell (APIC) and ASFLIP advection methods for fluid simulation, providing a reference implementation for these advanced fluid dynamics algorithms.

tools.name: EBGeometry
tools.one_line_profile: Library for embedded boundary (EB) geometry generation
tools.detailed_description: A C++ package designed for generating embedded boundary geometries, likely for use in Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD) simulations involving complex boundaries.

tools.name: OpenMMS
tools.one_line_profile: Open-source software for Mobile Mapping Systems
tools.detailed_description: A software and hardware project for Mobile Mapping Systems (MMS), enabling the collection and processing of geospatial data using LiDAR and GPS/IMU sensors.

tools.name: Sailfish
tools.one_line_profile: Lattice Boltzmann fluid simulation package for GPUs
tools.detailed_description: A high-performance Lattice Boltzmann Method (LBM) simulation package designed for GPUs, supporting both CUDA and OpenCL backends for fluid dynamics simulations.

tools.name: REMORA
tools.one_line_profile: GPU-enabled Regional Ocean Modeling System
tools.detailed_description: A GPU-accelerated version of the Regional Ocean Modeling System (ROMS), developed under the SciDAC program for high-performance oceanographic simulations.

tools.name: SEEKR2
tools.one_line_profile: Simulation-Enabled Estimation of Kinetic Rates
tools.detailed_description: A software tool for calculating the kinetics of molecular binding and unbinding events using molecular dynamics simulations and milestoning theory.

tools.name: Jutul.jl
tools.one_line_profile: Fully-differentiable multi-physics finite-volume simulator
tools.detailed_description: A Julia package for fully differentiable multi-physics simulations using finite-volume methods. It is designed for reservoir simulation and other porous media flow problems.

tools.name: Alamo
tools.one_line_profile: Solvers for solid mechanics with Adaptive Mesh Refinement
tools.detailed_description: A C++ library providing explicit and implicit solvers for solid mechanics problems, featuring Adaptive Mesh Refinement (AMR) capabilities.

tools.name: SPARTA
tools.one_line_profile: Direct Simulation Monte Carlo (DSMC) software package
tools.detailed_description: A parallel DSMC code for simulating low-density gases. It uses a hierarchical Cartesian grid and is designed for high-performance computing environments.

tools.name: SPH-EXA
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance SPH hydrodynamics simulation code
tools.detailed_description: A C++20 simulation code for performing hydrodynamics simulations using Smoothed Particle Hydrodynamics (SPH), parallelized with MPI, OpenMP, CUDA, and HIP.

tools.name: cellGPU
tools.one_line_profile: GPU-accelerated simulations of cell tissue models
tools.detailed_description: A software package for GPU-accelerated simulations of Voronoi and vertex models of biological cells and tissues.

tools.name: MeshTaichi
tools.one_line_profile: Compiler for efficient mesh-based operations in Taichi
tools.detailed_description: A compiler extension for Taichi that optimizes mesh-based operations, enabling efficient simulation and processing of mesh data structures.

tools.name: Taichi
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance parallel programming language for graphics and simulation
tools.detailed_description: An open-source, imperative, parallel programming language for high-performance numerical computation. It is widely used for differentiable physics, computer graphics, and scientific simulations on GPUs.

tools.name: taichi.js
tools.one_line_profile: Web runtime for Taichi kernels
tools.detailed_description: A library that allows running compiled Taichi kernels in JavaScript and WebAssembly, enabling high-performance physics simulations and graphics in web browsers.

tools.name: Taichi-Blend
tools.one_line_profile: Blender integration for Taichi physics simulation and animation
tools.detailed_description: A bridge tool that integrates the Taichi physics engine with Blender, allowing users to run high-performance physics simulations directly within the Blender environment for scientific visualization and animation.

tools.name: Taichi Elements
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance multi-material continuum physics engine
tools.detailed_description: A high-performance physics engine written in Taichi, focusing on multi-material continuum physics simulations using the Material Point Method (MPM).

tools.name: Taichi GLSL
tools.one_line_profile: GLSL-like helper library for Taichi physics and graphics
tools.detailed_description: An extension library for Taichi that provides GLSL-alike math and helper functions, facilitating the development of physics simulations and rendering kernels.

tools.name: Taichi Three
tools.one_line_profile: Soft renderer for visualizing Taichi simulations
tools.detailed_description: A soft rendering engine built on Taichi, designed to provide 3D visualization capabilities for physics simulations and other Taichi-based applications.

tools.name: 2d-fluid-simulator
tools.one_line_profile: 2D incompressible fluid solver in Taichi
tools.detailed_description: A 2D incompressible fluid simulation implementation using Taichi, serving as a lightweight solver for fluid dynamics.

tools.name: simple-simulate-complex
tools.one_line_profile: OpenMM workflow for protein-ligand complex simulation
tools.detailed_description: A simplified workflow and script collection for setting up and running protein-ligand complex simulations using the OpenMM toolkit.

tools.name: Solver-in-the-Loop
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for interacting with iterative PDE solvers via differentiable physics
tools.detailed_description: A framework for 'Solver-in-the-Loop' methodologies, enabling learning from differentiable physics to interact with and improve iterative PDE solvers.

tools.name: apebench
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmark suite for autoregressive neural emulation of PDEs
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive benchmark suite designed for evaluating autoregressive neural emulators of Partial Differential Equations (PDEs), supporting 1D, 2D, and 3D cases with differentiable physics integration.

tools.name: Qrack
tools.one_line_profile: GPU-accelerated quantum computer simulator framework
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive, GPU-accelerated framework for developing and simulating universal virtual quantum processors, supporting high-performance quantum circuit simulation.

tools.name: hoomd-tf
tools.one_line_profile: TensorFlow plugin for HOOMD-blue MD simulations
tools.detailed_description: A plugin that enables the integration of TensorFlow with HOOMD-blue, allowing for GPU-accelerated machine learning driven molecular dynamics simulations.

tools.name: TaichiMD
tools.one_line_profile: GPU-accelerated Molecular Dynamics in Taichi
tools.detailed_description: An interactive, GPU-accelerated Molecular Dynamics simulation engine implemented using the Taichi programming language.

tools.name: voxcraft-sim
tools.one_line_profile: GPU-accelerated voxel-based physics engine
tools.detailed_description: A GPU-accelerated physics engine designed for voxel-based simulations, often used in evolutionary robotics and soft body physics research.

tools.name: taichi_3d_gaussian_splatting
tools.one_line_profile: 3D Gaussian Splatting implementation in Taichi
tools.detailed_description: An implementation of 3D Gaussian Splatting for real-time radiance field rendering using Taichi, useful for 3D reconstruction and scientific visualization.

tools.name: dtaidistance
tools.one_line_profile: Fast Dynamic Time Warping (DTW) library for time series
tools.detailed_description: A library for time series distance computation, specifically offering a fast implementation of Dynamic Time Warping (DTW) in C with Python bindings, suitable for scientific data analysis.

tools.name: OpenMMDL
tools.one_line_profile: Setup interface for OpenMM protein-ligand simulations
tools.detailed_description: A tool that provides an interface to OpenMM, facilitating the easy setup and execution of molecular dynamics simulations for protein-ligand complexes.

tools.name: Xsuite
tools.one_line_profile: Multiparticle simulation suite for particle accelerators
tools.detailed_description: A suite of Python packages designed for multiparticle simulations of particle accelerators, providing tools for tracking and beam dynamics analysis.

tools.name: Xtrack
tools.one_line_profile: Particle tracking simulations on CPU and GPU
tools.detailed_description: A Python package within the Xsuite ecosystem for high-performance tracking simulations in particle accelerators, supporting both CPU and GPU execution.

tools.name: TaichiSLAM
tools.one_line_profile: 3D dense mapping backend for SLAM in Taichi
tools.detailed_description: A 3D dense mapping backend library for Simultaneous Localization and Mapping (SLAM) implemented in Taichi, designed for aerial swarm applications and spatial modeling.

tools.name: TaichiSimplicialFluid
tools.one_line_profile: Simplicial fluid simulation solver in Taichi
tools.detailed_description: An implementation of fluid simulation on simplicial complexes using Taichi, allowing for interactive surface flow simulations.

tools.name: taichi_LBM3D
tools.one_line_profile: 3D sparse Lattice Boltzmann Method solver in Taichi
tools.detailed_description: A 3D sparse Lattice Boltzmann Method (LBM) fluid solver implemented using Taichi, designed for high-performance fluid dynamics simulations.

tools.name: PBD_Taichi
tools.one_line_profile: Position Based Dynamics (PBD/XPBD) engine in Taichi
tools.detailed_description: A physics engine implementing Position Based Dynamics (PBD) and Extended PBD (XPBD) in Taichi, supporting various constraints for mesh and tetrahedron simulations.

tools.name: taichi_mpm
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance MLS-MPM solver
tools.detailed_description: A high-performance implementation of the Moving Least Squares Material Point Method (MLS-MPM) solver, widely used for simulating continuum mechanics and multi-material interactions.

tools.name: zpc
tools.one_line_profile: Parallel computing library designed for high-performance physics-based simulations
tools.detailed_description: ZPC (Zenus Parallel Computing) is a C++ library developed by Zenus Tech to support their physics-based simulation ecosystem. It provides infrastructure for parallel processing, likely optimizing data structures and algorithms for multi-physics simulations on HPC hardware.

tools.name: fdtd3d
tools.one_line_profile: High-performance FDTD electromagnetics solver with MPI, OpenMP, and CUDA support
tools.detailed_description: fdtd3d is an open-source solver for the Finite-Difference Time-Domain (FDTD) method in electromagnetics. It supports 1D, 2D, and 3D simulations and is highly optimized for various hardware architectures including x64, ARM, and GPUs via CUDA, utilizing MPI and OpenMP for parallelism.

tools.name: taichi-TopOpt
tools.one_line_profile: Topology optimization framework leveraging Taichi for high-performance computing
tools.detailed_description: A topology optimization framework implemented in Python using the Taichi programming language. It utilizes the Solid Isotropic Material with Penalization (SIMP) method and leverages Taichi's automatic differentiation and GPU acceleration capabilities for efficient structural design and optimization.
